UNICO 20°87° Hotel Riviera Maya: Complete Resort Guide

Locally Immersive Luxury All-Inclusive

Last updated: January 2025

UNICO 20°87° (named for its exact coordinates) launched with a radical premise: what if an all-inclusive actively pushed guests to leave? The resort includes one excursion per stay because they want you to experience the real Riviera Maya. Local artisans created the décor, regional distilleries supply the tequila, and your personal "host" (they refuse to say butler) acts as cultural concierge. The result is a luxury all-inclusive that feels connected to place rather than isolated from it.

In This Guide

  • Overview & Vibe
  • Accommodations
  • Dining
  • The Host Experience
  • Included Excursion
  • Pools & Beach
  • Spa & Wellness

  • Booking Tips

Overview & Vibe

{<strong>The UNICO Philosophy:</strong></p><p>UNICO exists to prove that all-inclusive doesn't mean generic. Every element—art, spirits, cuisine, excursions—connects to the Riviera Maya specifically. The hotel partners with local artisans, features regional artists, and insists guests experience the destination.</p><p><strong>Key Stats:</strong></p><ul><li>448 rooms and suites</p><ul><li>Beachfront location (Kantenah Bay)</p><ul><li>3 pools (including adults-only)</p><ul><li>5 restaurants</p><ul><li>One excursion per stay included</p><ul><li>Opened 2017</p><ul><li>Adults-only</p><p><strong>The Vibe:</strong></p><ul><li>Contemporary Mexican design</p><ul><li>Locally immersive programming</p><ul><li>Social yet sophisticated</p><ul><li>Design-forward without being cold</p><ul><li>Active cultural calendar</p><ul><li>Adults-only but not stuffy</p><p><strong>What Makes UNICO Different:</strong></p><ul><li>"Host" service (personal concierge)</p><ul><li>Included excursion to local attraction</p><ul><li>Art from local/regional artists throughout</p><ul><li>Spirits from specific distilleries</p><ul><li>Cultural programming calendar</p><ul><li>Cueva Siete speakeasy</p><p><strong>Who Stays Here:</strong></p><ul><li>Culturally curious travelers</p><ul><li>Design enthusiasts</p><ul><li>Couples wanting luxury + adventure</p><ul><li>Foodies who want quality and variety</p><ul><li>Those who hate generic resorts</p><ul><li>Social travelers who appreciate good bars}

Accommodations

{<strong>Room Categories:</strong></p><p><strong>Alcoba Pool View (from $1,200/night)</strong></p><ul><li>592 sq ft</p><ul><li>Pool or garden views</p><ul><li>Rainfall shower</p><ul><li>Host service</p><ul><li>Local art pieces</p><p><strong>Alcoba Ocean View ($1,400-1,600)</strong></p><ul><li>592 sq ft</p><ul><li>Caribbean views</p><ul><li>Private balcony</p><ul><li>Premium floor location</p><p><strong>Alcoba Swim Out ($1,600-1,800)</strong></p><ul><li>592 sq ft with pool access</p><ul><li>Step directly into pool from terrace</p><ul><li>Ground floor location</p><ul><li>Premium privacy</p><p><strong>Estancia Ocean View ($1,800-2,200)</strong></p><ul><li>904 sq ft suite</p><ul><li>Living area separate from bedroom</p><ul><li>Larger terrace</p><ul><li>Enhanced amenities</p><p><strong>Estancia Swim Out ($2,000-2,500)</strong></p><ul><li>904 sq ft with pool access</p><ul><li>Suite configuration</p><ul><li>Most requested category</p><ul><li>Book early</p><p><strong>All Rooms Include:</strong></p><ul><li>Personal host service</p><ul><li>Bathroom with rain shower + tub</p><ul><li>Local artisan décor</p><ul><li>Dyson hair dryer</p><ul><li>Premium spirits in minibar</p><ul><li>L'Occitane amenities</p><ul><li>Pillow menu</p><ul><li>24-hour room service</p><ul><li>Daily refreshed minibar</p><ul><li>WiFi throughout}

Dining

{<strong>Five Restaurants, All Outstanding:</strong></p><p><strong>Cueva Siete (Speakeasy Bar)</strong> Not technically a restaurant, but UNICO's crown jewel. Hidden speakeasy with Mexico's best cocktail program. Mezcal flights, creative cocktails, intimate atmosphere. Find the hidden entrance.</p><ul><li>Evening only</p><ul><li>Reservations recommended</p><ul><li>Drinks and small plates</p><p><strong>Mi Carisa (Steakhouse)</strong> Premium cuts with Mexican preparations. Excellent carne asada, ribeye, and filet. Grilled sides, quality wine list.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><ul><li>Reservations recommended</p><p><strong>Cuerno (Mexican)</strong> Contemporary Mexican with regional focus. Yucatecan specialties, creative tacos, mole flights. The most "local" dining option.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><p><strong>Mura House (Asian)</strong> Japanese-inspired with teppanyaki and sushi bar. Excellent sashimi, creative rolls, theatrical cooking.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Teppanyaki requires reservation</p><p><strong>Café Urbano</strong> All-day dining with international menu. Breakfast buffet plus à la carte, lunch options, casual dinner.</p><ul><li>Breakfast, lunch, dinner</p><ul><li>Casual</p><p><strong>Pool & Beach Service:</strong></p><ul><li>Full menu at pools and beach</p><ul><li>Ceviches, tacos, sandwiches</p><ul><li>Full cocktail menu</p><p><strong>Room Service:</strong></p><ul><li>24-hour availability</p><ul><li>Full menus from all restaurants</p><ul><li>Private dining setups on balcony}

The Host Experience

{<strong>Personal Concierge Service:</strong></p><p>UNICO's "host" concept replaces traditional butler service with cultural concierge. Your host handles practical needs but also connects you to authentic experiences.</p><p><strong>What Hosts Do:</strong></p><ul><li>Pre-arrival contact to understand preferences</p><ul><li>Meet you at arrival, handle check-in</p><ul><li>Restaurant reservations and recommendations</p><ul><li>Excursion booking and customization</p><ul><li>Cultural experience suggestions</p><ul><li>Spa appointments</p><ul><li>Special occasion arrangements</p><ul><li>Problem resolution</p><ul><li>Local tips and knowledge</p><p><strong>The Difference:</strong> Traditional butlers focus on luggage and room service. UNICO hosts focus on experience curation. They'll tell you where to find the best tacos in town, arrange a mezcal tasting with a local producer, or suggest the cenote that isn't crowded.</p><p><strong>How to Use Your Host:</strong></p><ul><li>Contact pre-arrival with interests</p><ul><li>Share dietary restrictions</p><ul><li>Ask for off-menu experiences</p><ul><li>Request local recommendations</p><ul><li>Let them handle problems</p><ul><li>Tip appropriately (they're excellent)}

Included Excursion

{<strong>One Adventure Included:</strong></p><p>Every UNICO stay includes one excursion—their statement that all-inclusive should mean experiencing the destination.</p><p><strong>Excursion Options:</strong></p><p><strong>Cenote Discovery</strong> Guided swim through two cenotes with transportation. Most popular choice.</p><p><strong>Tulum Ruins</strong> Private guide to the clifftop Mayan ruins with history and context.</p><p><strong>Snorkel Adventure</strong> Boat trip to reef with equipment and guide.</p><p><strong>Bike & Tacos</strong> Cycling tour through local neighborhoods ending with street tacos.</p><p><strong>Cooking Class</strong> Market tour and hands-on Yucatecan cooking.</p><p><strong>How It Works:</strong></p><ul><li>Choose excursion with host</p><ul><li>Transportation included</p><ul><li>Professional guides</p><ul><li>Small group or private options</p><ul><li>Schedule around your preferences</p><p><strong>Why This Matters:</strong> Most AI guests never leave the property. UNICO builds leaving into the rate—forcing guests to see the real Riviera Maya. Many guests return from excursions planning their next off-property adventure.}

Pools & Beach

{<strong>Three Pool Environments:</strong></p><p><strong>Main Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Large infinity pool</p><ul><li>DJ and events (daytime)</p><ul><li>Swim-up bar</p><ul><li>Full food and beverage service</p><ul><li>Social atmosphere</p><p><strong>Adults-Only Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Quieter option</p><ul><li>More intimate</p><ul><li>Same service level</p><ul><li>Better for reading/relaxing</p><p><strong>Spa Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Part of spa facility</p><ul><li>Hydrotherapy features</p><ul><li>Very peaceful</p><p><strong>Kantenah Bay Beach:</strong></p><ul><li>Protected cove</p><ul><li>Generally calmer waters</p><ul><li>Less seaweed than some areas</p><ul><li>Full service (food, drinks, towels)</p><ul><li>Palapa shade structures</p><ul><li>Water sports available</p><p><strong>Beach Amenities:</strong></p><ul><li>Loungers and umbrellas</p><ul><li>Beach beds with service</p><ul><li>Shade structures</p><ul><li>Direct food and cocktail service</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Beach yoga (scheduled)</p><p><strong>What's Included:</strong></p><ul><li>Kayaking</p><ul><li>Paddle boarding</p><ul><li>Snorkeling equipment</p><ul><li>Beach volleyball}

Spa & Wellness

{<strong>Esencia Spa:</strong></p><p>The spa integrates local ingredients and traditions with contemporary techniques. Regional botanicals feature prominently.</p><p><strong>Facilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Treatment rooms (single and couples)</p><ul><li>Hydrotherapy circuit</p><ul><li>Steam and sauna</p><ul><li>Relaxation areas</p><ul><li>Beauty salon</p><ul><li>Fitness center (24-hour)</p><ul><li>Yoga/meditation studio</p><p><strong>Signature Treatments:</strong></p><p><strong>Mayan Journey (2 hours, $350)</strong> Clay wrap, local honey, traditional massage techniques.</p><p><strong>Agave Ritual (90 min, $280)</strong> Blue agave body treatment with massage.</p><p><strong>Local Immersion (2.5 hours, $400)</strong> Comprehensive treatment using all local ingredients.</p><p><strong>Couple's Retreat (2 hours, $550)</strong> Private suite, side-by-side treatments, champagne.</p><p><strong>Wellness Programming:</strong></p><ul><li>Daily yoga classes</p><ul><li>Meditation sessions</p><ul><li>Fitness classes</p><ul><li>Personal training available</p><ul><li>Nutrition consultations</p><p><strong>Spa Note:</strong> Spa treatments are additional cost (not included in AI rate). Grand Velas includes more; UNICO focuses all-inclusive value elsewhere.}

Practical Information

{<strong>Getting There:</strong></p><ul><li>Cancún Airport (CUN): 45 minutes</p><ul><li>Private transfer included in rate</p><ul><li>Playa del Carmen: 20 minutes north</p><ul><li>Tulum: 25 minutes south</p><p><strong>Location Advantage:</strong> Kantenah Bay sits between Playa del Carmen and Tulum—easy access to both. The bay offers protected swimming and generally better seaweed management.</p><p><strong>What's Included:</strong></p><ul><li>All meals and snacks</p><ul><li>Premium spirits and wines by the glass</p><ul><li>Personal host service</p><ul><li>One excursion per stay</p><ul><li>Airport transfers</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Fitness classes</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Gratuities</p><p><strong>What Costs Extra:</strong></p><ul><li>Spa treatments</p><ul><li>Premium wine bottles</p><ul><li>Motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Additional excursions</p><ul><li>In-room champagne/wine</p><ul><li>Golf (nearby courses)</p><p><strong>Best Time to Visit:</strong></p><ul><li>Peak: December-April</p><ul><li>Best value: May-June, November</p><ul><li>Summer: Hot but lower rates</p><ul><li>Watch: Hurricane season Sept-Oct</p><p><strong>Dress Codes:</strong></p><ul><li>Mi Carisa: Smart casual (no shorts)</p><ul><li>Other restaurants: Resort casual</p><ul><li>Cueva Siete: Smart casual</p><ul><li>Pool/beach: Swimwear appropriate}

Pros & Cons

{<strong>Why Choose UNICO 20°87°:</strong></p><p>✅ <strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Locally immersive philosophy (not generic)</p><ul><li>Cueva Siete is exceptional (best bar)</p><ul><li>Host service elevates experience</p><ul><li>Included excursion gets you out</p><ul><li>Design and art throughout</p><ul><li>Protected bay beach</p><ul><li>Adults-only sophisticated</p><ul><li>Swim-out suites available</p><ul><li>Premium spirits truly premium</p><ul><li>Cultural programming engaging</p><p>❌ <strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Spa not included (unlike Grand Velas)</p><ul><li>Fewer restaurants than Grand Velas</p><ul><li>No kids (adults-only throughout)</p><ul><li>Can feel social/energetic (not for total seclusion)</p><ul><li>Pool scene during day</p><ul><li>$1,200+ nightly rate</p><ul><li>Not as established as competitors</p><ul><li>Limited suite sizes</p><p><strong>Compared to Alternatives:</strong></p><ul><li>vs. Grand Velas: UNICO for local immersion, GV for dining variety</p><ul><li>vs. Excellence: UNICO more contemporary/cultural</p><ul><li>vs. Secrets: UNICO better design and spirits</p><ul><li>vs. Rosewood: UNICO for AI value, Rosewood for exclusivity}

Booking Tips

{<strong>How to Book:</strong></p><p><strong>Best Approaches:</strong></p><ol><li>Direct booking often has promotions</p><ol><li>Costco Travel packages</p><ol><li>Compare swim-out upgrade cost</p><ol><li>Travel advisors can add perks</p><p><strong>Room Selection:</strong></p><ul><li>Ocean View: Best value with view</p><ul><li>Swim Out: Worth upgrade for access</p><ul><li>Estancia: Only if you need space</p><ul><li>Avoid Pool View unless budget constrained</p><p><strong>Making the Most of UNICO:</strong></p><ul><li>Contact host pre-arrival</p><ul><li>Choose excursion based on interests</p><ul><li>Book Cueva Siete for first night</p><ul><li>Plan one specialty dinner per night</p><ul><li>Use host for local recommendations</p><ul><li>Don't skip the included excursion</p><p><strong>Cueva Siete Strategy:</strong></p><ul><li>Find the entrance (ask host)</p><ul><li>Go early evening (less crowded)</p><ul><li>Try the mezcal flight</p><ul><li>Let bartenders recommend</p><ul><li>Return multiple times</p><p><strong>What to Request:</strong></p><ul><li>High floor for views</p><ul><li>Away from main pool (if quiet preference)</p><ul><li>Restaurant reservations pre-arrival</p><ul><li>Excursion preference noted</p><ul><li>Any dietary requirements}

Frequently Asked Questions

How does UNICO compare to Grand Velas?

Grand Velas wins on restaurant quantity and spa inclusion. UNICO wins on local immersion, bar program, and contemporary design. Grand Velas feels more traditionally luxurious; UNICO feels more connected to Mexico. Both are excellent—choose based on priorities.

What is Cueva Siete and why is everyone talking about it?

It's UNICO's hidden speakeasy with arguably the best cocktail program at any Mexican resort. The bartenders are craft cocktail experts, the mezcal selection is exceptional, and the intimate atmosphere is perfect. Finding the entrance is part of the fun—your host will help.

Is the included excursion actually good?

Yes—it's a real excursion with professional guides, not a watered-down version. Most guests return wanting to book more. The cenote trip and Tulum ruins are most popular. It's UNICO's way of ensuring guests experience the real Riviera Maya.

What does the host service actually mean day-to-day?

Your host handles everything a concierge would—reservations, arrangements, problems—but with cultural depth. They know local recommendations, can arrange authentic experiences, and personalize your stay. Contact them before arrival with your interests for the best service.

Is UNICO good for honeymoons?

Excellent. The swim-out suites are romantic, Cueva Siete is perfect for date nights, and the adults-only atmosphere is sophisticated without being stodgy. The included excursion adds adventure to romance. Hosts can arrange special touches throughout.
